org.epochx.life
Interface ReproductionListener

All Known Implementing Classes:
ReproductionAdapter
public interface ReproductionListener

Provides the interface to be implemented by objects that wish to handle reproduction events. See the ReproductionManager's class documentation for details of when each reproduction event will be fired. To listen for reproduction events during execution of a model, instances of ReproductionListener must be added to the model's LifeCycleManager which is retrievable through a call to the model's getLifeCycleManager() method.

It is typical to listen to events using an anonymous class which often makes the abstract ReproductionAdapter class more convenient to implement.

See Also:
ReproductionAdapter, ReproductionManager

Method Detail

onReproductionStart

void onReproductionStart()
Event fired before the reproduction operation starts.

onReproduction

CandidateProgram onReproduction(CandidateProgram program)
Event fired after the selection of a program to be reproduced. The selected program may be modified and returned. This event is revertable by returning null which will trigger the discarding of the program and the reselection of a new one. This event will then be raised again. If the reproduction should be accepted then the program should be returned as it is, or it may be modified.

Parameters:
program - the program that was selected to be reproduced.
Returns:
a CandidateProgram that should be used as the reproduced program and inserted into the next population.

onReproductionEnd

void onReproductionEnd()
Event fired after the reproduction operation has ended and been accepted.
